values:
YEAH BOY!!!


Maybe I should start writing in this again...??

Guess who hasn't updated in a long time!?
I don't know why I'm so awful at writing lately.  I think I'm just a lazy bastard. lol

Let's see...Abby is getting very big!  She is crawling relentlessly, pulling herself up to standing, and really talking a LOT.  And she's pretty much the cutest thing in the world right now!  It's going to be very interesting to see how she behaves when her little sister or brother is born.

That's right...We're pregnant again!  It was a little bit sooner than we had planned, but we're happy.  The new baby will be born around August 5, so we have a lot planning to do.

I'm a little over two months away from PCSing to Ft. Meade and joining the Field Band.  I'm really excited about it, and a bit nervous.  I don't want to get up there and do a poor job and have my bosses think they made the wrong choice.  I'm sure that's just natural with any new job, but it's still there!  

We're in the process of looking for houses in that area.  We got approved for a VA Loan and found a realtor.  We'll be meeting with her the second week of February and hopefully we can nail something down that we really like and can afford.

The week before that, though, I'll be going to Texas with the Jazz Band for a little tour.  I hope that we come together and put on some great shows.  Nothing worse than a bad Jazz concert! lol  I'm looking forward to it, but I'm sad to leave Erin alone for a week.  

This past Tuesday we traded in our 2003 Honda Civic for a brand spanking new 2009 Honda Accord.  It's blue and awesome... We really wanted to get the Odyssey, but the payments were just too high.  We had to haggle for a lower monthly payment, but we got it down to a respectable amount.  We were spoiled by my old payments cuz I got a KILLER deal on that car, but we'll make due.

So, from Tuesday through the next eight months, we have/will have a new:
1. President (woot!)
2. Car
3. House
4. Job
5. Baby

wow...that's a lot of change in a short amount of time!  But everything is very exciting and I look forward to see what else 2009 has in store for us!

I hope you're all doing well.  Rest assured that I have been keeping tabs on all of you.

Michael Crichton died?!
This is a very sad day...
I loved his novels.  He has added a lot to our imaginations.
Your stories and memory will live on.

Rest in Peace, Michael

http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20081105/ap_en_ot/obit_crichton

This really does not associate with my mood or anything.  I was listening to my iTunes while I was getting ready this morning and just was really moved by it. It's really the combination of the music and the lyrics, but the lyrics themselves are awesome. 

Exit Music for a film by Radiohead 


Wake from your sleep 
The drying of your tears 
Today we escape 
We escape 

Pack and get dressed 
Before your father hears us 
Before all hell breaks loose 

Breathe, keep breathing 
Don't lose your nerve 
Breathe, keep breathing 
I can't do this alone 

Sing us a song 
A song to keep us warm 
There's such a chill 
Such a chill 

You can laugh 
A spineless laugh 
We hope your rules and wisdom choke you 

Now we are one in everlasting peace 

We hope that you choke, that you choke 
We hope that you choke, that you choke 
We hope that you choke, that you choke

Well, it might be bigger than little.
I'll try to bring everyone up to speed on my life over the past few months!

Little Abigail is six months old now!
she's getting so big!  She's cut two teeth, she's babbling incessantly, and she's on the verge of crawling.
I'm more and more amazed by her everyday.

On August 29th, I finally got to go to a promotion board!
I was nervous as hell... I didn't know if I had studied nearly enough!
I was third to go, so the waiting KILLED me...
However, once I finally got in the room, it was ALL business.
CSM James asked me some facing movements then told me to sit down.  Said a few words and asked me to recite the Soldier's Creed.
I stood and belted that thing out loud and proud!  When I finished, CSM said "Man, Gunderson! I thought you were gonna crawl across this table and kill me!"
haha
Then he asked me if I knew the NCO Creed, which I said I did.
So I stood and recited it with one small glitch.
CSM then proceeded to "lecture" me on cutting my grass. HAHA 
That was funny.
And then it was OVER!
The board didn't ask me a SINGLE QUESTION...?!?! What?!
crazy

So, I leave to go back to the band hall.  I'm just sitting on my computer at work waiting until I have to go to PAC and take my promotion packet over.
In the mean time, I get an email from the US Army Field Band which contained a message inviting me to interview for the Assistant Librarian position there, which I had applied to earlier that week.
I was shocked! Two great things happened to me on the same day?! 
CRAZY!
so, Erin and I went out to dinner that night...alone!  Our friend Andrea watched Abby for us, and we had a lovely time, just sitting, talking, laughing, eating, and drinking a very nice Riesling.

SO...
Fast-forward to Tuesday.
I drive up to Ft. Meade, MD for the interview on Wednesday.
I get to the hotel that the Field Band put me up in...
NICE hotel!  It was a suite... I had a sitting room, a KITCHEN, the whole nine yards.
Well, I took it easy, watched some tv, read a little bit, got some dinner.
And of course, knowing that it would be a big day tomorrow, I went to bed early...
AND
DIDN'T
SLEEP!!
ACK!

Don't you hate that crap!?
Oh man, I just couldn't fall asleep! It was horrible.
so my alarm goes of Wednesday morning and I feel like CRAP.
But I get up, shower, eat some breakfast, and meet the other applicants at the front door so we can be driven to the interview.

There were only three of us accepted this far: a girl was from the Mannheim band and a guy from Ft. Riley.
So we get to the Field Band.
We get a mini-tour.
Then we take a WRITTEN test...ACK! I didn't know about that! I would've studied more! haha
but for the most part it was horrible.  Just some answers I didn't remember, no big deal, right? 
heh...
I was nervous as crap...this was NOT a good sign... I should KNOW these answers.
Anyways, then we go into some scenarios...the librarian asked us things like "ok, so-and-so wants to borrow this piece..."
and so I asked her, "well, do we own the piece? is it in print? did someone here compose it?" yada yada yada.
and various other questions were asked... "who owns the copyright to 'Feliz Navidad?'" amongst others..
wow

then came the interviews!
we called in one by one.
I went last.
I was surrounded by five people who bombarded me with all sorts of questions...
"What do you think some of the short-comings of our library are?"
"Are you intimidated by rank?"
"What do you think about modularity in our field?"
"Explain your biggest challenge you had to overcome in the army."

man, it was brutal, but the were all great questions.

so, we all completed that and Sergeant Major Martin called us in to a side room.
He informed us that two people were advancing: SSG Miles...and myself.

Now we had to go through another interview...with the Commander of the Field Band, COL Palmatier.
zoinks!

So, SSG Miles went first.
was only in there about 3 minutes

Now it's my turn
I walk in
COL asked me one simple question: "Why do you want this job?"
So I told him about me experience and my passion and my commitment.
He said "you know there is no side door into my ensemble, right? You will not be a player...are you ok with that??"
and I of course said, "absolutely...I had resigned myself to that fate once, and I'm more than willing to do it again."

so I left the room.
the SGM came back and said "ok, let's go to lunch!"

UGH!!
I was mad!
making us wait like that!

so we went to a chinese buffet, a favorite of all Army Bandsmen. lol
and we chatted
and stewed!

got back to the field band and the SGM called the two remaining candidates into his office.
And he says "you should both be proud of yourselves so far; you're both great candidates for this position.  However, we've decided to extend the position to...SPC Gunderson."

*blink blink*

what?

excuse me?

You meant SSG Miles right?!

HOLY CRAP!
I'm going to be joining the FIELD BAND in about six months or so!!!
This is GREAT!

I was so pumped and excited I didn't know what to say!
I was told to go talk to CSM Keller, so I walked through a haze of disbelief and chatted with him for awhile.
I FINALLY got to leave and get back to my car at the hotel at 4pm so that I could call my nervous-as-hell wife, Erin, and tell her the news! She had been pacing back and forth all day, poor thing!

so...
yeah!
that's my story and I'm sticking to it!
I know most of you know the story already, but for those of you that don't....there it is!
I'll be an E-5 next month.
then I'll be an E-6 in a few months, once I join the Field Band!

thanks for taking the time to read.
Sorry I don't post that much anymore. I know I used to be an avid poster.
I guess I'm just a lazy bastard! :-P

peace out, yallz

so sad..

I loved his humour, and I will miss him.

Rest in Peace, George...

hey all
not gonna write a lot now, but just wanted everyone to know that the three of us are home and everything's going well.
it's was a long 6 days in the hospital, but it's worth it to have this little bundle of joy with us!

I'll update with more info and hopefully pictures later! 

thanks for all the well wishes! 
:-)

So Erin and I went to the doctor yesterday for our weekly check up...
and they decided to set an induction date...
for NEXT TUESDAY!!!
Holy crap, by this time next week, I'll be a DAD!!

Abigail will be here hopefully next Tuesday!!

so, if any of you guys would like to get photos of the wee one via email, just reply here with your email address and I'll try my damnedest to get them to you as soon as I can!


I'm gonna be a DAD!!!

Ssssoooo....

it's been like...a decade since I last posted anything of significance.  I will attempt to do so now, but it might be a bit rambly and nonsensical.

For the record, just because I don't post doesn't mean I don't READ.  I try to read through my friends page a few times a week and keep up with all your dirty deeds that done dirt cheap...or something...

Things have been a roller coaster here in beautiful "oh wait, I forgot what f'n SEASON it is" Southeastern Virginia.  
The baby time clock is quickly ticking to the inevitable day when me and Erin are no longer the only people occupying our house (aside from our adorable kitties).  That's right... my parents-in-law are visiting... Just kidding!
but seriously, little Abigail is due in less than three weeks!  I'm gonna be a DAD?! What is THAT all about?!
I'm really nervous but excited at the same time.  Most people probably don't think that I'm that excited about it, but I really am.  It'll be amazing to have this little child that I will be responsible for to mold into a decent human being.
Quite a daunting task!
But I know that with the help of my loving and amazing wife, we will be able to provide a house full of love and joy.
March 4 here we come!

Speaking of babies, I have to welcome Evan Hartlieb into the world!  Nicole's son was born this morning around 4:00 am (what a LONG day yesterday was!) weighing in at 9 lbs 2 ozs!  I can't wait to see him! :-)

Things at work have been crazy.  It's been a lot of ups and downs emotionally and musically.  
Back in October, we took a PT test, and I scored miserably on it.  I passed, but I had the single lowest score in the unit...embarrassing!  
Then I was given the info that I wouldn't be eligible for promotion until I got my PT score up.  Totally shitty, but them's the breaks.
So, I started working with my friend Angie to get a lot better at everything.  I was running all the time, working out, yada yada.  Then she gets pregnant and can't work out anymore... BUMMER! 
So I try to rework my work out regimen so that I can train for another PT test.   I took that test last week...
and I didn't do much better. :-\
I did better, if only slightly, on my push-ups and sit-ups, but worse on the run!  I worked REALLY hard on that run, and hardly worked on the other two.  I was VERY disappointed.  And I'm still not eligible to be promoted.  So, I'll have to kick things up another three notches and kill the test in April.  
It's hard for me though, because working out by myself doesn't quite work.  I need someone to pace me or something.  Don't know why... But I need to jumpstart this shit and get some f'n respect so that I can keep pace with my peers.

I also have been toying with this whole Officer thing.  I've started to take conducting lessons at Old Dominion University from the orchestra director there, Dr. Lucy Manning (who got her DMA from USC...I met her once or twice right before I left for Milwaukee).  She actually has me conducting the orchestra in concert, so that's exciting.  I just hope I can pull it off without looking like a jackass!
Unfortunately, I'm not able to make an audition tape for the next band officer audition.  It's due March 1 and I just have too much crap going on.  Plus, I'm not able to have any time with the band here to rehearse, so that didn't work out.
Sooo... I'm hoping that another audition pops up in September or so because I need to do this.  If I don't at least try for this, I'll be kicking myself in the ass for the rest of my life. 

what else....??

Man, I don't even know.  I just know that my life is going to change forever in the next three weeks, but all for the better.

I hope that you're all doing well, and I hope I can make more frequent updates.  I just don't have a drive to write like I used to.  Ah well!

Peace out, yallz

I know I  haven't updated in a long time. 
I'm sorry!
I've been uber busy trying to be all Army and junk... and with the baby on the way and all that I've been really at a lose for time to update! I do read a lot, but I just don't have the...talent for writing much anymore... kinda sad I know.
I'll try to make a post soon about everything that's been going on...

Karlheinz Stockhausen died Wednesday at the age of 79.
An influential composer, I remember learning about him in college and immediately loving his work.
New, fresh, different...and weird. But amazing music. So many people, in both the classical and pop worlds, were influenced by Stockhausen.

He will be missed.

Rest in Peace, Karlheinz...


http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20071208/ap_on_re_eu/obit_stockhausen_7

:-D

I lost my cell phone yesterday... :-\

so, be that as it may, I will need everyone's phone number again! so, if you think that I should have your number, or just want to give it to me anyways, send me a message here or send me an email at irishclarinet@gmail.com!

Rest in Peace, Marcel Marceau, the beloved French mime, who's art transcended all cultures and ages.
I remember seeing him on TV when I was younger. I know a lot of people have problems with mime, but I think it's a really cool art. It's an awesome way to show true expression when all you can use is physical acting and no vocal acting.

Farewell, Marcel. You will be missed.

http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20070923/ts_afp/entertainmentfranceartsmimemarceau_070923091052

man, I don't know why I've been so bad about updating lately...

what's been going on?
Erin and I have moved on base. the house is really nice and we've got most of our stuff unpacked and in place...sorta...
it's so nice to be able to walk or bike to work 

things at work have been going well. the big summer concert series is over. it's sad in a way cuz it was like having a real gig having to prepare new music every week. but a break from all that is good, too!
next week I have to go to a Combat Life Savers Course at Ft. Eustis. Basically, I get to learn how to give someone an IV and how to get them out of a battlefield without hurting them more. yay! but it's 8 promotion points, so I'll go for it.

I just went to the School of Music in Norfolk today to have a teacher evaluation for a future gig there. They wanted to hear me play a little and then teach an AIT student.
So, I played the beginning of the Copland Concerto. and, amazingly, even to myself, I played the HELL out of it! it was amazing. the high Es were smooth and beautiful, so I'm really happy about that.
Then the teaching part came. The student was decent. Not a horrible player, but had some problems I could address. I talked about tone and tempo, which were the two things that the panel were looking for. 
So, needless to say, I got the recommendation to be a teacher at the school! That's awesome to have for my future in the Army. Options are always good to have in this job!

Other than that, it's just been me and Erin preparing ourselves to be parents! It's still crazy to think that we'll soon be parents! I'm sure the next 6 months will fly by.

alrighty, I'm gonna go and spend time with the wife.

hope you're all doing well.

peace out, yoz

as Maryann so eloquently put it, what have I been up to??

I'll make a real post sometime this weekend. Been really busy with stuff.

so look for a real update soon! :-)

PS GO CUBS!!

Madeleine L'Engle, the famed author of the book A Wrinkle in Time, has passed away at the age of 88. I remember reading a lot of her books when I was in elementary school. Perhaps I should re-read them and get reacquainted... Rest in Peace, Madeleine. Your stories shall live forever. http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20070907/ap_on_re_us/obit_l_engle

Rest in Peace, Luciano Pavarotti...

A dynamic tenor, Luciano is one of most recognizable and beloved voices of the 20th century. He made me fall in love with opera. I never got to see him live, but I have many recordings, both on CD and DVD. 

Poor Luciano fell to pancreatic cancer at the age of 71.

Good bye, Mr. Pavarotti. Your final curtain call is coupled with a standing ovation from this fan...


http://news.aol.com/entertainment/music/story/ar/_a/a-legendary-voice-goes-silent/20070905142309990001

Rest is Peace, Merv Griffin The entertainment pioneer who created such shows as Jeopardy! and Wheel of Fortune, died at the age of 82 from prostate cancer. Your show's will live on, as will your legacy. We will miss you, Merv... http://tv.yahoo.com/show/31376/news/urn:newsml:tv.ap.org:20070812:obit_merv_griffin__ER

Rest in Peace, Ingmar Bergman... 1918-2007... World-renowned director of such films as The Seventh Seal, Wild Strawberries and a movie version of Mozart's Magic Flute. Your artistry will live for ever...

well, I haven't posted in a while.
is it seriously almost AUGUST?!?
a lot has happened in the past few weeks.
first and foremost, for those that don't know, Erin and I found out we're gonna parents! We found out on 7/7/07! Our lucky day. hehe
the baby will probably due on or around March 12, 2008...how crazy is that!!?? :-)

My playing has been getting better. Got a lot of good practice in last week.
Robert Spring from Arizona State came to town Wednesday to play with us on Thursday.
We of the clarinet section got to play for him in a masterclass on Wednesday.
I had to go first (lucky me!), so I played some Copland for him. Just the beginning and some of the cadenza.
He was VERY complimentary of my playing, telling me he enjoyed my playing every time I saw him until he left Thursday night. That felt good to hear :-)
He played the Rigoletto fantasy with us Thursday night, followed by his signature "Flight of the Bumblebee." I was very impressed with his  playing. He did some things that I probably wouldn't have done, but he's very knowlegable and VERY nice...very genuine.

Also on Thursday night, I got to conduct the TRADOC band playing "Serenata" by Leroy Anderson. It went really well. I felt good up there; wasn't nervous at all.
Everyone was very complimentary of my conducting, and that makes me feel good.
It also really gets my creative juices flowing and my hopes up for applying for OCS. I really think I have a good shot at it as long as I keep working hard and proving myself as a musician and a soldier. I'm very glad the Captain let me work with the band!

In other news, an opening in the Pershing's Own Ceremonial Band is ripe for the picking. I've been given permission to apply for it. I just have to call them up and make sure what they want on the tape and work up a technical piece to put on there. Everything from my recital last year was mostly lyrical and standard, so I needed something more contemporary with lots of finger waggling. I'll probably pull out the Martino that I played for my F2.

Also I need to get over to the school and get my instructor qualification done. I want to keep my options WIDE open so that I can have OPTIONS for my reenlistment, ya know?

Next week is our jazz concert for the Music Under the Stars concert series. And SFC Felkner has put quite a few clarinet solo pieces in there! It's gonna be an awesome opportunity for me to shine! (...or totally suck... lol)  There's one Benny Goodman tune on there that's SMOKIN, an Artie Shaw piece, and a Woody Herman chart.... Crazy times! Pray that I don't take a huge crap on these classic tunes!! lol
alright, that's it for now. It's gonna storm here in a bit and I need to get to the store.

I hope you're all doing well!

peace out, yallz

<u>Come as You Are</u>

There's a knock at the door.
I wonder if it's you, babe,
Coming home in tears,
Realizing your mistakes.
You walked out Thursday,
Said you'd be back Friday.
Now it's Tuesday and I
Can't wait til Wednesday.
Sure we had our problems
But ain't that the norm?
I don't care if you come back,
Just know that I'm here.

But just come as you are,
I promise it's ok.
Just do as you like all night
And I'll still come back 
In the morning.

Making up or making out
Doesn't matter 'long as you're about.
Don't got time to sit and reminisce,
Just got offered the job of a lifetime.
But all that's null and void
Unless you come aboard.
Take a chance,
It's ok with me,
Just give me that one clear sign.

If you will come as you are,
I promise it's ok.
Just stay out all night,
If you still come back
In the morning.

6 July 2007

Former WWE superstar Chris Benoit, his wife, and their young child were found dead in their Georgia home.

I remember watching him when I was still a wrestling fan for all those years. 
He was crazy, but he was an awesome performer.
This is truly a sad day for wrestling and the Benoit family.
It's listed as a potential homicide..
Who would do this?!

Rest In Peace, Chris... You will be missed

tonight me and Erin are going out for SUSHI! YUMMY! that better be good! I've heard good things about the place, but we'll see...

we had fun for the most part. talking b.s., having some drinks

and while we were there he bought me a frickin iPod! I was surprised by that one!
but it's cool

but that's taken care of too...should be getting the part today or tomorrow! (the dvd/cd burner...burned out...haha)

let's see...
Erin's going to Milwaukee on Sunday for a week. Then we'll both be up there the 13-17 of July as previously stated last post. should be a wild time! :-P

what else?
my hand still hurts. hopefully it'll get better soon. I need to start playing again so that I can stop sucking at the clarinet!

I guess that's it for now

peace out yall

I'm going to see COWBOY MOUTH on Friday!! :-D
woot!

let's see what i can update on my life here in sunny VA...

Had some concerts lately...things are going fine with that
not exactly the most challenging music, but it's alright.

We had a concert last night. Everything went well
but after the concert, I was on the load crew to break everything down and put it back in the band hall.
while unloading a timpani, i ran the box into a brick column.
unfortunately, my HAND was between the box and the column.
smashed the ever-loving CRAP out of it.
so I had to go to the doctor this morning.
put me on profile for a week to let it heal...no playing for a week?! DAMN!
and I have a jazz band gig next week!
I've been working really hard on it and now I don't get to play it. :-(
I'm really cheesed about this.
hell, my hand is hurting just typing this message...WTF?!

in other news, the Captain has asked me conduct on a concert in July! 
When he told me, I was really surprised!
I know we had talked about the possibility, but I didn't think it would happen so soon!
this could be a great opportunity for me, especially if I do well, and especially if I want to do OCS.
and on top of that the possibility of playing the Artie Shaw Concerto with the band, and I could well be on my way to establishing myself as a good Army Musician here.
we'll just have to wait and see!

For all my Milwaukee minions (j.k!), I will be back in Milwaukee July 13-17! YAY!
not as long as I want to be home for, but I don't have a lot of leave saved up.
c'est la vie. *shrugs*
5 days is better than no days!

what else...?

I guess that's about it for now.
My parents are coming up for a quick visit this weekend.
that should be...interesting. lol

Hope you're all doing well!

peace out, yallz

and I don't know where this update will go
I'm kinda in a funky mood right now
Erin is in Williamsburg for a few days, working the end of the festival, so I'm home alone.
I have tomorrow off as a "breather" day to catch my breath before the MUTS season starts.

but right now, I don't care about all that.
I was over at our neighbors' house until just now.
But I felt uncomfortable.
Chris's mom and two sisters were over there.
we had gone to the pool
and we were all messing around, doing stupid shit.
but apparently his mom thought that I was "clinging" to his sisters too much
they're 13 and 15
uh...dude...
wtf?!
yeah, I was playing with them. throwing the ball, trying to wrestle it away from them, yada yada yada.
and after we got back, me and Chris were outside and he told me this.
I got really pissed off.
not at him, of course. 
I just shut up and laid back
left everyone alone.
and then his mom tried to get friendly and ask me about my job
i dunno...

as i was telling Carolyn (Chris's wife), I have this..."complex"

when people aren't satisfied with the way I act or whatever, I don't just let their disappointment get to me... I get down on MYSELF, and make myself feel WORSE.
I don't care who it is.
My wife, my boss, whoever
I got better at it for a while
I just didn't care about what anybody said or did to me. I just let shit roll off my back.
i guess it's come back
I shouldn't let this bother me, I suppose
but I DO...
cuz I can't help who I am
I like to have fun
and have someone tell me I was being inappropriate or whatever?
yeah...pisses me off
but whatever

I don't even want to write about anything else that's happened, and a lot has happened.

I think Erin and I just need to get away from here for a while, by ourselves. she's stressed, I'm becoming complacent.

we'll see what happens in the coming months with this whole Army thing.
I've been contemplating going back to school to get my DMA. I really want it and then go teach somewhere. It's my passion. I love to teach people what I'm passionate about.
but I haven't been passionate about the clarinet lately.
I'm trying to get it back though
kinda like my passion for writing
i don't know where THAT went either
but if I find some new music to be inspired by, both to listen to and to play, I think I can get it back

the writing however, who knows

I don't even know if this shit makes sense...
or if anyone will even read it.
but whatever
it's written and I've spoken my mind.

i'm out




ps, the cubs still suck...

fuckers


pps, some cool stuff has happened lately...i should write about that tomorrow maybe...

ok, so I haven't updated this thing in forEVER...

I've been at Ft. Monroe for a month now.
Everything is going really well.
People here are REALLY nice and I think I'll fit in well.
I've been put in the admin office, responsible for leaves/passes and in/out processing.
Everyone in this office is really cool, but I'm upset that my boss is going to be leaving soon :-(
she's really awesome, and I'll miss her when she leaves

haven't been playing much clarinet lately. I'm playing second alto in the jazz band. difficult to get back into the swing of things, since I haven't played in a jazz band since...1997! Great!
but it's going pretty well. A little more practice and I should be doing alright. As long as I don't have to solo, I'll be good!

The busy season is about to start. Gigs 2-3 times a week! NICE! I like to be busy, so this'll be a welcome change from the innui that surrounds me right now.

I need another car though. Erin uses the car to go to work and I have to fight for a ride home every day. Hopefully my bonus money'll come in soon and we can get another car cuz I need reliable transportation to accomplish what I want to get done every day.

We have some really nice neighbors. A young couple that's around our age. They have a 2 year old daughter who is adorable. She'll see me and just start yelling "Matt! Matt!"
adorable. :-)

the neighborhood isn't GREAT, but it's not terrible. We'll probably end up moving on base eventually though, so that'll be good.

hrm...I guess that's about it for now.

I guess I should think about doing some practicing :-P

hope you're all doing well!

peace out, yoz

The Cubbies are doing better.
no longer in last place! SCORE!
last place in the NL Central?
the CARDINALS!!
AWESOME!
let's hope our offense comes around and we can start to win some more games!

GO CUBBIES! :-)
